concept.title: What's changed in version 1.0.0.1
concept.shortdesc: Understand the changes that are delivered as part of version 1.0.0.1

dlentry.dt: Topic strings that start with $SYS are reserved for system use

dd.p: Topic strings that start with $SYS are reserved for internal use. For example, publishes performance monitoring messages on topic strings that start with $SYS.

dlentry.dt: The MaxMessages parameter in messaging policies

dd.p: The MaxMessages parameter specifies the maximum number of messages that are kept for a subscription. This parameter is no longer accepted when you create or update a messaging policy where DestinationType=Queue.

dlentry.dt: The RetainedMessages parameter in destination mapping rules

dd.p: The RetainedMessages parameter can be used to specify that either all the messages, or none of the messages, that are forwarded by using the destination mapping rule are forwarded as retained messages. This parameter overrides any settings from the original message publisher. You can specify that all messages are retained messages only for destination mapping rules with a single queue manager connection. The destination mapping rule cannot be a rule that maps to an queue, or a queue.

conbody.p: You can view the documentation for version 1.0.0.1 here: 1.0.0
